ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] How to recover a job without the GUI - a large seed file (7M urls) will not load
ygData.msgSnippet: The jobs and profiles in under the directory ./jobs, the complete job should be named as completed-randomNumber , copy this directory and rename it to

--0-1898113768-1242632392=:39306
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

The jobs and profiles in under the directory ./jobs, the complete job shoul=
d be named as "completed-randomNumber", copy this directory and rename it t=
o "ready-anotherRandomNumber". 
In this way, the seeds you set in the job c=
an be copied to this ready job. The seeds in under the /jobs/*/seeds.txt. 
=
Then restart the Heritrix, you can find out a ready job under the GUI, and =
launch it.
=C2=A0
BTW, the seeds.txt could only save 32K content. If you gi=
ve one job 7M seeds, it will only save the first 32K. You'd better split th=
e seeds to multi-jobs.
=C2=A0

-Thanks
-Michelle

--- 09=E5=B9=B45=E6=9C=88=

=E6=97=A5=E6=9C=9F: 2009=E5=B9=

=
I'm running a job seeded with 7M urls. It ran to about 25% completion, then=
 died. I'm now trying to restart the job (new job based on recovery-log) , =
but the web GUI is loading the seed list into the browser and it's taking f=
orever (hours) and my browser's probably going to crash. How can I do this =
via the command-line or just restart the old job? I really don't want to st=
art this over from scratch.
